use_cases_desc: A classroom polling example where students are asked to target a part of an UML diagram corresponding to the question. More generally, this paper uses a motivating scenario in which cross-device targeting is required despite the lack of network connectivity, specifically, without any visual cues on the targeting device (e.g., smartphones).
contribution_desc: This paper proposes a non-visual interaction technique called "spatial correspondence targeting" in which the user can select content on a targeted surface (e.g., a large display) by finding the relative corresponding spatial position on a targeting surface (e.g., a smartphone), much like how an artist begins to create a painting. A study shows that users could localize targets presented on a large display within 4% of the display area on a smartphone.
